SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent

Class TEST11_US020203_EventGeolocationUITest

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.TEST11_US020203_EventGeolocationUITest
public class TEST11_US020203_EventGeolocationUITest extends Object
UI tests for US 02.02.03: As an organizer I want to enable or disable the geolocation requirement for my event.

These instrumented tests verify that the geolocation toggle switch is properly displayed and functional in both CreateEventFragment and UpdateEventFragment, allowing organizers to enable or disable the geolocation requirement for their events.

Note: For reliable test execution, it's recommended to disable animations on the test device/emulator before running these tests: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 0
To re-enable animations after testing: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 1

    • TEST11_US020203_EventGeolocationUITest

      public TEST11_US020203_EventGeolocationUITest()

  • Method Details

    • scrollToSwitch

      private void scrollToSwitch()
      Scrolls to the geolocation switch to ensure it's visible on screen. The switch is inside a ScrollView, so we need to scroll to it first.

    • performReliableClickOnSwitch

      private void performReliableClickOnSwitch()
      Performs a click action on the geolocation switch that works better with animations enabled. First scrolls to ensure the view is fully visible, then performs a reliable click.

    • organizer_geolocationToggle_displayedInCreateEvent

      public void organizer_geolocationToggle_displayedInCreateEvent()
      Test Case 1: Geolocation toggle switch is displayed in CreateEventFragment. As an organizer, when I navigate to create a new event, I should see the geolocation requirement toggle switch.

    • organizer_geolocationToggle_defaultsToUncheckedInCreateEvent

      public void organizer_geolocationToggle_defaultsToUncheckedInCreateEvent()
      Test Case 2: Geolocation toggle starts unchecked in CreateEventFragment. As an organizer, when I create a new event, the geolocation requirement should be disabled by default.

    • organizer_enableGeolocation_inCreateEvent_toggleWorks

      public void organizer_enableGeolocation_inCreateEvent_toggleWorks()
      Test Case 3: Organizer can enable geolocation toggle in CreateEventFragment. As an organizer, I should be able to toggle the geolocation requirement switch to enable it when creating a new event.

    • organizer_disableGeolocation_inCreateEvent_toggleWorks

      public void organizer_disableGeolocation_inCreateEvent_toggleWorks()
      Test Case 4: Organizer can disable geolocation toggle in CreateEventFragment. As an organizer, I should be able to toggle the geolocation requirement switch to disable it when creating a new event.

    • organizer_toggleGeolocation_multipleTimes_inCreateEvent

      public void organizer_toggleGeolocation_multipleTimes_inCreateEvent()
      Test Case 5: Organizer can toggle geolocation multiple times in CreateEventFragment. As an organizer, I should be able to change my mind and toggle the geolocation requirement multiple times before creating the event.

    • organizer_geolocationToggle_displayedInUpdateEvent

      public void organizer_geolocationToggle_displayedInUpdateEvent()
      Test Case 6: Geolocation toggle switch is displayed in UpdateEventFragment. As an organizer, when I navigate to update an existing event, I should see the geolocation requirement toggle switch. Note: This test assumes navigation to UpdateEventFragment is possible. In a real scenario, you would need to have an existing event to update.

    • organizer_enableGeolocation_inUpdateEvent_toggleWorks

      public void organizer_enableGeolocation_inUpdateEvent_toggleWorks()
      Test Case 7: Organizer can enable geolocation toggle in UpdateEventFragment. As an organizer, I should be able to toggle the geolocation requirement switch to enable it when updating an existing event.

    • organizer_disableGeolocation_inUpdateEvent_toggleWorks

      public void organizer_disableGeolocation_inUpdateEvent_toggleWorks()
      Test Case 8: Organizer can disable geolocation toggle in UpdateEventFragment. As an organizer, I should be able to toggle the geolocation requirement switch to disable it when updating an existing event.

    • organizer_geolocationToggle_persistsOnNavigation

      public void organizer_geolocationToggle_persistsOnNavigation()
      Test Case 9: Geolocation toggle state persists when navigating away and back. As an organizer, if I toggle the geolocation requirement and navigate away, the state should be preserved when I return (for the same session).

    • organizer_geolocationToggle_independentOfOtherFields

      public void organizer_geolocationToggle_independentOfOtherFields()
      Test Case 10: Geolocation toggle is independent of other form fields. As an organizer, when I toggle the geolocation requirement, it should not affect other form fields like event name, description, or max entrants.
